definition: clean/completely/only/net (income, exports etc)/(Chinese opera) painted face male role

sentences.english: Since replacement costs are only part of the profits, net profits are higher.
sentences.chinese: 因为替代成本仅仅是利润的一部分，所以净利润更高。

sentences.english: Shenzhen Development Bank's 25 percent growth is the lowest.
sentences.chinese: 净利润同比增长最慢的深发展也保持了25%的增长。

sentences.english: In this case, the overstatement of bad debt expense unjustifiably understates the present year's net income .
sentences.chinese: 这样，坏账费用的高估会不合理地低估当年的净利润。

sentences.english: How much of the check was profit?
sentences.chinese: 这张支票的净利润是多少？

sentences.english: Chinese pharmaceutical makers' lower net profit margin suggests their operations are less efficient.
sentences.chinese: 中国药企较低的净利润率表明他们的经营效率较低。

sentences.english: If they go up, you add the number to Net Income.
sentences.chinese: 如果它们上升，就应该往净利润上添加相应的数额。

sentences.english: But net profit still rose 12 per cent to HK$14.2bn.
sentences.chinese: 但公司净利润仍增长12%，至142亿港元。

definition: achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
to make good a deficit/to reverse a loss
